lines.text: Oh, I've made a mistake.
Yes? Let me see.
Isn't it awful?
Oh you poor kid. You're all worn out.
I don't care.
Anne, you're glorious.
Am I?
I've just discovered you.
You see that office building over there?
It's an architectural monstrosity.
In every office there's a stenographer.
You called them potential mothers last time.
How do you like this, "Most woman holding important business positions today have come up by the stenographer private secretary route."
Ha, there's a long, long trail a winding.
Now listen, "A man is propelled toward the woman he marries by emotion."
The fool!
"But his selection of a secretary is more careful and intelligent."
Ha! Yes it is, I don't think. First he looks at her legs. Then, he smells her perfume. Then he stares at her face. And if he still admires her legs, he's sold.
Behave. I'm serious.
You mean, the modern business man's secretary is closer than his wife, yet, not his wife.
Come in, Miss Murdock. Sit down. Well, you're being promoted.
Promoted! I have?
Yes. Miss Andrews resigned last night. You are to be Mr. Fellows new secretary.
Yeh.
You see, he's leaving next week, for Europe, on his honeymoon. While he's gone, you'll have entire charge of his office. So, you'll know what its all about when he gets back. Congratulations.
Weeeee!
[Jumps up]
Oh, I'm sorry.
Your new salary begins next week, but, I'm going to give you a week off so you'll get used to the idea.
Oh, thank you, Mr. McGowan.
And, Anne, you got this, on your work. What I mean is, charm counts, but, you got this on your brains. Don't forget that Anne.
In deed, I won't, Mr. McGowan.
Now, run along, fix your face.
Thank you.
Sis, aren't you going to work? Sis!
No.
Fired? I thought you would be. You know, you can't, with people the way you do. Who made a play for you?
Nobody.

No, don't tell me that, Anne. Honest, you ought to get wise to yourself. Take me, for instance. I gained six pounds, maybe more, but still I'm the pet model of the elite dress shop. And you know why? Because, I let that frog of a manager kiss me on the ear, every now and then.
I got my raise on brains, not good looks. Mr. McGowan said so.
Yeah, and how much is your raise? A dollar a week?

If you come home nights, before I'm asleep, you might learn something. I'm the President's private secretary and I've got a weeks vacation. And, I'm to handle the office until he gets back from Europe. My salary's 45 a week and how do you like that?
Don't you suppose I know what this business game is for a girl? It's about as fair as a marriage game. Catch as catch can and anything goes!
I got a glimpse of her once, out on the beach.
Did you really?
Yes. Her knees are perfect. Don't forget, Anne, her knees are magnificent.
Miss Murdock, he wants you.
Oh?
For, dictation purposes.
I don't suppose Larry ever thought to offer you a high ball?
She doesn't use them.
Oh, well, of course if you know that, but I'm sure you don't. I bet he didn't offer you one.
I'll have some tea later.
Well, I suppose tea's alright if it works. Goodnight, my dear.
Goodnight.
Oh, tell me Larry, are you coming to bed?
Coming right now.
Righto.
Expect to console yourself with that washout?
If I'd stuck to my own kind, in the first place, I wouldn't have gotten hurt.
Ted wants a parking space for a couple of babies and a free laundry. If you want to learn what the word lonesome is, take him on.
